Course Description: USE OF COMPUTERS IN ACCOUNTING SYSTEMS, EMPHASIZING "HANDS ON" USE OF OPERATING SYSTEMS, WORD PROCESSING, SPREADSHEET, DATABASE MANAGEMENT, COMMUNICATIONS, AND OTHER SOFTWARE IN ACCOUNTING.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
UPON COMPLETION OF THIS COURSE, STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO:

1.UNDERSTAND COMPUTERIZED ACCOUNTING SYSTEMS AND CYCLES
2.RECOGNIZE AND UNDERSTAND THE FUNCTIONS AND THE PURPOSE OF ACCOUNTING SYSTEMS IN BUSINESSES
3.EXAMINE AND DETERMINE THAT ACCOUNTING FEATURES AND CONTROLS ARE RECORDED CORRECTLY AND ACCURATELY
4.APPLY DEVELOPMENT PROCESS IN AN ACCOUNTING INFORMATION SYSTEM
Textbook(s): HOLLANDER, S., DUNN, C & CHERRINTON, (2004). ENTERPRISES INFORMATION SYSTEMS (3RD ED).  NEW YORK, NY: MCGRAW-HILL. [ISBN 0-07-240429-9]
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
